Breakfast.Title: Greek Yogurt and Oatmeal Breakfast Bowl
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1/2 cup rolled oats
1 cup water
1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt
1/4 cup chopped nuts (almonds, pecans, or walnuts)
1/4 cup fresh berries (blueberries, raspberries, or strawberries)
1 tablespoon honey
Breakfast.Instructions:
In a small saucepan, bring the rolled oats and water to a boil over medium heat.

Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the oats are cooked and the mixture has thickened.

Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for 1-2 minutes.

Spoon the cooked oats into a bowl and top with the Greek yogurt, chopped nuts, fresh berries, and honey.

Serve and enjoy!

Breakfast.Title: Lentils Soup
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1 cup brown lentils, rinsed and drained
2 cups water
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 onion, sliced
2 garlic cloves, minced
2 carrots, sliced
1 bell pepper, sliced
2 cups broccoli florets
1/4 cup soy sauce
1 tablespoon honey
1 tablespoon cornstarch
Salt and pepper, to taste
Breakfast.Instructions:
In a medium saucepan, combine the brown lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. Drain any excess water and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add the carrots, bell pepper, and broccoli to the skillet, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, and cornstarch.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the vegetables in the skillet, and stir to coat.
Add the cooked lentils to the skillet, and stir to combine.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened and the lentils and vegetables are heated through.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.

Breakfast.Title: Chickpea Salad
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
1 red bell pepper, chopped
1/2 red onion, chopped
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 garlic clove, minced
Salt and pepper, to taste
Breakfast.Instructions:
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chickpeas, red bell pepper, red onion, and chopped parsley.

In a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.

Pour the dressing over the chickpea mixture and toss to coat.

Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of the salad.

Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Breakfast.Title: Peanut Butter and Banana Sandwich
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 slices of whole wheat bread
2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter
1 ripe banana, sliced
Honey (optional)
Breakfast.Instructions:
Spread the peanut butter on one slice of the bread.

Top with the sliced banana and drizzle with honey, if desired.

Top with the second slice of bread.

Slice the sandwich in half and serve.

Breakfast.Title: Oatmeal Breakfast Bowl
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1/2 cup rolled oats
1 cup milk
1/2 banana, sliced
1 tablespoon honey
1 tablespoon chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Pinch of salt
Breakfast.Instructions:
In a small saucepan, bring the milk to a simmer over medium heat.

Add the rolled oats, banana, honey, cinnamon, and salt to the saucepan.

Stir to combine and reduce the heat to low.

Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the oatmeal is thick and creamy.

Pour the oatmeal into a bowl and top with chopped nuts.

Serve hot.

Breakfast.Title: Veggie Breakfast Sandwich
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 slices of whole wheat bread
2 tablespoons hummus
1/4 avocado, sliced
1/4 cup sliced cucumber
1/4 cup sliced tomato
1/4 cup sliced bell pepper
1/4 cup sliced red onion
Salt and pepper, to taste
Breakfast.Instructions:
Toast the slices of bread to your liking.
Spread one slice of bread with the hummus and the other with the sliced avocado.
Layer the cucumber, tomato, bell pepper, and red onion on one slice of bread.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with sprouts or microgreens, if using.
Place the other slice of bread on top to make a sandwich.
Serve immediately.

Breakfast.Title: Quinoa Breakfast Bowl
Breakfast.Ingredients:
/2 cup cooked quinoa
1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt
1/2 cup mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries)
1 tablespoon honey
1 tablespoon chopped nuts (such as almonds or pecans)
Pinch of cinnamon
Breakfast.Instructions:
In a small mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa and Greek yogurt.

Top with mixed berries, chopped nuts, and a drizzle of honey.

Sprinkle with cinnamon to taste.

Serve cold or at room temperature.

Lunch.Title: Chickpea and Vegetable Stir-Fry
Lunch.Ingredients:
1 cup cooked chickpeas
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell pepper, onion, and broccoli)
1 tablespoon olive oil
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 teaspoon honey
Serve over 1 cup cooked brown rice.
Lunch.Instructions:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil to the skillet and let it heat up for a minute.

Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Add the cooked chickpeas to the skillet and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the chickpeas are heated through.

In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and honey. Pour the mixture over the chickpea and vegetable mixture in the skillet and stir to coat everything evenly.

Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

Serve the chickpea and vegetable stir-fry hot over cooked brown rice, if desired.

Lunch.Title: Lentil and Vegetable Curry
Lunch.Ingredients:
1 cup cooked lentils
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, bell pepper, and carrot)
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon curry powder
1/2 cup canned coconut milk
Serve over 1 cup cooked quinoa.
Lunch.Instructions:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil to the skillet and let it heat up for a minute.

Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Stir in the curry powder and cook for an additional minute, or until fragrant.

Add the cooked lentils to the skillet and stir to combine everything.

Pour in the canned coconut milk and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.

Serve the lentil and vegetable curry hot over cooked quinoa, if desired.

Lunch.Title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Bowl
Lunch.Ingredients:
1 medium sweet potato, baked and diced
1/2 cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
1/4 cup salsa
1/4 cup diced avocado
Serve over 1 cup cooked brown rice.
Lunch.Instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Spread the cubed sweet potato on a baking sheet and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and toss to coat everything evenly.

Roast the sweet potato in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned.

In a large bowl, combine the cooked black beans, sliced avocado, and chopped cilantro. Add the roasted sweet potato to the bowl and stir everything together gently.

In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the lime juice. Pour the dressing over the sweet potato and black bean mixture and stir everything together gently.

Serve the sweet potato and black bean bowl hot over cooked quinoa, if desired.

Lunch.Title: Grilled Veggie Sandwich
Lunch.Ingredients:
2 slices of whole wheat bread
2 tablespoons hummus
1/4 cup sliced cucumber
1/4 cup sliced tomato
1/4 cup sliced bell pepper
1/4 cup sliced red onion
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
Lunch.Instructions:
Preheat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.

Brush the sliced vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

Grill the vegetables for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until lightly charred and tender.

Toast the whole wheat bread slices until lightly browned.

Spread the hummus evenly on one slice of the toasted bread. Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese on top of the hummus.

Layer the grilled vegetables on top of the feta cheese. Top with a handful of baby spinach leaves.

Cover the sandwich with the remaining slice of toasted bread.

Cut the sandwich in half and serve immediately.

Lunch.Title: Quinoa and Vegetable Bowl
Lunch.Ingredients:
1 cup cooked quinoa
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as zucchini, bell pepper, and onion)
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
Lunch.Instructions:
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chopped mixed vegetables, and canned chickpeas. Stir everything together gently.

In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Pour the dressing over the quinoa and vegetable mixture and stir everything together gently.

Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

Top the quinoa and vegetable bowl with sliced avocado.

Serve the quinoa and vegetable bowl immediately, either cold or at room temperature.

Lunch.Title: Chickpea and Avocado Salad
Lunch.Ingredients:
1 cup cooked chickpeas
1/2 avocado, diced
1/2 cup diced cucumber
1/2 cup diced tomato
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Lunch.Instructions:
In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, diced avocado, chopped red onion, chopped cucumber, chopped red bell pepper, and chopped fresh cilantro.

In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lime juice. Pour the dressing over the chickpea and avocado mixture and stir everything together gently.

Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

Serve the chickpea and avocado salad immediately, either cold or at room temperature.

Lunch.Title: Broccoli and Cheddar Soup
Lunch.Ingredients:
2 cups chopped broccoli florets
1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese
1 tablespoon butter
1 tablespoon flour
1 cup vegetable broth
1/2 cup milk
Lunch.Instructions:
In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.

Add the chicken or vegetable broth to the pot and bring it to a boil.

Add the chopped broccoli to the pot and reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and let the broccoli simmer until it is tender, about 10-15 minutes.

Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool slightly.

Using an immersion blender or a regular blender, puree the soup until it is smooth.

Return the soup to the pot and stir in the heavy cream and shredded cheddar cheese until the cheese is melted and the soup is creamy.

Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.

Serve the broccoli and cheddar soup immediately, garnished with additional shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Dinner.Title: Roasted Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
Dinner.Ingredients:
1 cup quinoa, rinsed
2 cups vegetable broth
1 sweet potato, peeled and chopped
1 red bell pepper, chopped
1 zucchini, chopped
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
Salt and pepper to taste
1 avocado, sliced
Dinner.Instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss the chopped sweet potato, chopped red bell pepper, and chopped zucchini with the olive oil and smoked paprika until everything is well coated.
Spread the vegetables out in a single layer on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender and lightly browned.
In a medium pot, bring the quinoa and vegetable broth to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the quinoa simmer until it is cooked and the broth is absorbed.
Divide the cooked quinoa between bowls and top each bowl with the roasted vegetables and sliced avocado.
Serve the roasted vegetable and quinoa bowls hot.

Dinner.Title: Vegetable Fried Rice
Dinner.Ingredients:
2 cups cooked brown rice
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 small onion, diced
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 bell pepper, chopped
1 cup frozen mixed vegetables
2 tablespoons soy sauce
Salt and pepper to taste
Dinner.Instructions:
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the chopped bell pepper and frozen mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked brown rice to the skillet and stir everything together.
Stir in the soy sauce and season the fried rice with salt and pepper to taste.

Dinner.Title: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
Dinner.Ingredients:
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 small onion, diced
2 garlic cloves, minced
3 cups vegetable broth
1 can diced tomatoes
1 cup chopped mixed vegetables (such as carrots, celery, and zucchini)
1 cup cooked lentils
1 teaspoon dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
Dinner.Instructions:
Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, chopped mixed vegetables, cooked lentils, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the pot.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.

Dinner.Title: Vegetarian Chili
Dinner.Ingredients:
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 small onion, diced
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 bell pepper, chopped
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can diced tomatoes
1 cup frozen corn
1 tablespoon chili powder
Salt and pepper to taste
Dinner.Instructions:
Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the chopped bell pepper to the pot and cook for about 3 minutes.
Add the drained and rinsed black beans, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, frozen corn, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the pot.
Bring the chili to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until it thickens.

Dinner.Title: Spaghetti with Roasted Tomatoes and Garlic.
Dinner.Ingredients: spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper, Parmesan cheese.
Dinner.Instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Toss cherry tomatoes and garlic with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast for 20-25 minutes. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Toss cooked spaghetti with the roasted tomatoes and garlic, and top with grated Parmesan cheese.

Dinner.Title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
Dinner.Ingredients: cauliflower, peas, carrots, onion, garlic, eggs, soy sauce, olive oil, salt, pepper
Dinner.Instructions: Grate cauliflower using a food processor or cheese grater. Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil, and add peas and carrots. Add the grated cauliflower, and cook for 5 minutes. Push the cauliflower mixture to one side of the pan, and scramble the eggs on the other side. Mix everything together, and season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.

Dinner.Title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
Dinner.Ingredients: sweet potatoes, spinach, feta cheese, onion, garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper
Dinner.Instructions: Prick sweet potatoes with a fork, and bake at 400°F for 45-60 minutes. In a pan, sauté onion and garlic in olive oil, and add spinach. Cook until the spinach is wilted. Cut a slit in each sweet potato, and stuff with the spinach mixture and crumbled feta cheese.

Snacks.Title: Cucumber and tomato salad
Snacks.Instructions: Mix sliced cucumbers and cherry tomatoes with a drizzle of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

Snacks.Title: Trail mix
Snacks.Ingredients: Almonds, cashews, raisins, and dark chocolate chips.
Snacks.Instructions: Mix together almonds, cashews, raisins, and dark chocolate chips.

Snacks.Title: Avocado toast
Snacks.Instructions: Toast a slice of whole wheat bread, and top with mashed avocado, salt, and pepper.

Snacks.Title: Baked sweet potato fries
Snacks.Instructions: Cut sweet potatoes into thin fries, toss with olive oil and seasonings, and bake in the oven at 400°F for 20-30 minutes.

Snacks.Title: Greek yogurt with berries
Snacks.Instructions: Top a serving of Greek yogurt with mixed berries.

Snacks.Title: Hummus and veggies
Snacks.Instructions: Dip sliced carrots, celery, and bell peppers in hummus.

Snacks.Title: Roasted chickpeas
Snacks.Instructions: Rinse and drain a can of chickpeas. Toss with olive oil and seasonings, and roast in the oven at 400°F for 20-30 minutes.

Breakfast.Title: Bacon and egg breakfast sandwich
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 slices of bread
2 slices of bacon
1 egg
1 slice of cheddar cheese
Butter or oil for frying
Breakfast.Instructions: Cook the bacon until crispy. Remove from pan and set aside. Beat the egg in a bowl and fry in the same pan with butter or oil. Toast the bread and assemble the sandwich with the bacon, egg, and cheese.

Breakfast.Title: Ham and cheese omelette
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 slice of ham, diced
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Butter for frying
Breakfast.Instructions: Beat the eggs with salt and pepper. Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the eggs and let cook for a minute. Add the ham and cheese to one side of the omelette. Fold the other side over the filling and cook until the cheese is melted.

Breakfast.Title: Breakfast burrito
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1 tortilla
2 eggs
1/4 cup cooked sausage, crumbled
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Salsa and sour cream for serving
Breakfast.Instructions: Beat the eggs with salt and pepper. Fry in a non-stick pan with butter or oil. Warm the tortilla in the microwave or on a griddle. Add the cooked sausage, eggs, and cheese to the tortilla. Fold into a burrito and serve with salsa and sour cream.

Breakfast.Title: Smoked salmon and cream cheese bagel
Breakfast.Ingredients:
1 bagel
2 oz smoked salmon
2 tbsp cream cheese
1 slice of red onion
1 slice of tomato
Capers for garnish
Breakfast.Instructions: Toast the bagel. Spread cream cheese on both halves. Top with smoked salmon, onion, and tomato. Garnish with capers.

Breakfast.Title: Steak and egg breakfast skillet
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 eggs
1/2 cup cooked steak, diced
1/2 cup diced potatoes
1/4 cup diced bell pepper
Salt and pepper to taste
Butter for frying
Breakfast.Instructions: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potatoes and cook until golden brown. Add the bell pepper and steak and cook for 1-2 minutes. Beat the eggs with salt and pepper and pour into the skillet. Cook until the eggs are set.

Breakfast.Title: Huevos rancheros
Breakfast.Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 tortilla
1/4 cup black beans
1/4 cup salsa
1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Oil for frying
Breakfast.Instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the tortilla until crispy. Spread the black beans over the tortilla. Fry the eggs in the same skillet. Place the eggs on top.

Breakfast.Title: Breakfast Sandwich
Breakfast.Ingredients: English muffin, fried egg, cooked bacon or sausage, cheese.
Breakfast.Instructions: Fry the egg, then assemble the sandwich with the English muffin, fried egg, cooked bacon or sausage, and cheese.

Lunch.Title: Chicken Caesar Salad
Lunch.Ingredients: Grilled chicken, romaine lettuce, croutons, grated Parmesan cheese, Caesar dressing.
Lunch.Instructions: Arrange romaine lettuce on a plate, then top with grilled chicken, croutons, grated Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.

Lunch.Title: Chicken Fajita Bowl
Lunch.Ingredients: Grilled chicken, bell peppers, onions, black beans, brown rice, salsa, guacamole.
Lunch.Instructions: Cook brown rice according to package instructions. Sauté sliced bell peppers and onions until tender. Serve with grilled chicken, black beans, salsa, and guacamole.

Lunch.Title: Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry
Lunch.Ingredients: Grilled chicken, broccoli, carrots, onions, garlic, soy sauce, rice.
Lunch.Instructions: Sauté sliced onions and minced garlic until fragrant. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned. Add sliced broccoli and carrots, then stir in soy sauce. Serve over rice.

Lunch.Title: Turkey Club Sandwich
Lunch.Ingredients: Sliced turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise, bread.
Lunch.Instructions: Toast bread, then layer sliced turkey, cooked bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.

Lunch.Title: Beef Stir-Fry
Lunch.Ingredients: Salmon fillet, lemon, dill, salt, pepper, asparagus.
Lunch.Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Season salmon fillet with lemon, dill, salt, and pepper. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Serve with roasted asparagus.

Lunch.Title: Tuna Salad
Lunch.Ingredients: Canned tuna, celery, red onion, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, whole wheat bread.
Lunch.Instructions: Drain canned tuna, then mix with chopped celery, chopped red onion, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. Serve on whole wheat bread.

Lunch.Title: Beef Tacos
Lunch.Ingredients: Ground beef, taco seasoning, shredded cheese, diced tomato, shredded lettuce, sour cream, taco shells.
Lunch.Instructions: Brown ground beef, then stir in taco seasoning. Assemble tacos with beef, shredded cheese, diced tomato, shredded lettuce, and sour cream.

Dinner.Title: Shrimp Scampi
Dinner.Ingredients:
1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/4 cup butter
3 cloves garlic, minced
1/2 cup white wine
Juice of 1 lemon
Salt and pepper to taste
8 ounces linguine pasta
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
Dinner.Instructions:
Cook the pasta according to package instructions.

In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.

Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute.

Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.

Add the white wine and lemon juice, and cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened.

Season with salt and pepper.

Serve the shrimp and sauce over the cooked pasta, and garnish with chopped parsley.

Dinner.Title: Beef Stir-Fry
Dinner.Ingredients:
1 pound flank steak, sliced thinly
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1 tablespoon soy sauce
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 red bell pepper, sliced
1 yellow onion, sliced
1 cup sliced mushrooms
1 cup snow peas
Salt and pepper to taste
Cooked rice or noodles for serving
Dinner.Instructions:
In a bowl, mix the cornstarch and soy sauce.

Add the sliced beef to the bowl and toss to coat.

Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.

Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned.

Remove the beef from the pan and set aside.

Add the bell pepper, onion, mushrooms, and snow peas to the pan, and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender.

Return the beef to the pan and season with salt and pepper.

Serve the beef stir-fry with cooked rice or noodles.

Dinner.Title: Grilled Salmon with Sweet Potato Mash
Dinner.Ingredients:
4 salmon fillets
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
Juice of 1 lemon
2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
2 tablespoons butter
1/4 cup milk
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Dinner.Instructions:
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.

Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.

Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side or until fully cooked.

Boil sweet potatoes in a pot of water until tender.

Drain the water and mash sweet potatoes with milk, butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

Serve grilled salmon with sweet potato mash.

Dinner.Title: Grilled Chicken with Roasted Vegetables
Dinner.Ingredients:
4 chicken breasts
Salt and pepper
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon dried thyme
1 teaspoon dried rosemary
1 teaspoon dried oregano
2 zucchinis, sliced
2 bell peppers, sliced
1 onion, sliced
Dinner.Instructions:
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.

Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, thyme, rosemary, and oregano.

Brush chicken breasts with olive oil.

Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through.

In a separate baking dish, toss sliced zucchini, bell peppers, and onions with olive oil, salt, and pepper.

Roast vegetables in the oven at 400°F for 20-25 minutes, or until tender.

Serve grilled chicken with roasted vegetables.

Dinner.Title: Egg Fried Rice
Dinner.Ingredients:
3 cups cooked white rice
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup frozen peas and carrots
1/2 cup diced ham
1/4 cup soy sauce
2 green onions, sliced
Dinner.Instructions:
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Add beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.

Add frozen peas and carrots to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.

Add diced ham and cooked rice and stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes.

Pour in soy sauce and stir to combine.

Add scrambled eggs back to the skillet and stir to combine.

Serve with sliced green onions on top.

Dinner.Title: Spinach and Feta Omelette
Dinner.Ingredients:
3 eggs
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
1 cup fresh spinach
Salt and pepper
1 tablespoon butter
Dinner.Instructions:
Beat eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.

Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.

Add fresh spinach and sauté until wilted.

Pour beaten eggs over the spinach and let cook for 1-2 minutes.

Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over the eggs and fold in half.

Cook until eggs are set and cheese is melted.

Serve hot.

Dinner.Title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Herbs
Dinner.Ingredients:
4 salmon fillets, skin-on
Salt and pepper
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 lemons, sliced
4 sprigs fresh rosemary
4 sprigs fresh thyme
Dinner.Instructions:
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.

Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.

Brush both sides of the fillets with olive oil.

Place salmon fillets on the grill, skin-side down.

Add lemon slices, rosemary, and thyme on top of each fillet.

Grill for 4-6 minutes per side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

Serve immediately.

Snacks.Title: Deviled Eggs
Snacks.Ingredients:
6 hard-boiled eggs
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon black pepper
Paprika, for garnish
Snacks.Instructions:
Cut the hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise.

Remove the yolks and place them in a small bowl.

Mash the yolks with a fork.

Add mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper to the bowl with the yolks.

Mix everything together until it's smooth.

Spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg white halves.

Sprinkle paprika on top of the deviled eggs for garnish.

Snacks.Title: Egg Salad Sandwich
Snacks.Ingredients:
6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and chopped
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon black pepper
4 slices bread
Lettuce, for serving
Snacks.Instructions:
n a bowl, mix together the chopped hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper.

Toast the bread slices.

Place lettuce on two slices of the bread.

Spoon the egg salad on top of the lettuce.

Top the egg salad with the remaining bread slices.

Cut the sandwiches in half and serve.

Snacks.Title: Scotch Eggs
Snacks.Ingredients:
6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled
1 pound ground pork sausage
1/2 cup bread crumbs
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon dried parsley
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1 egg, beaten
Vegetable oil, for frying
Snacks.Instructions:
In a bowl, mix together the ground pork sausage, bread crumbs, salt, black pepper, dried thyme, dried parsley, and garlic powder.

Divide the sausage mixture into 6 equal portions.

Flatten one portion of the sausage mixture in your hand.

Wrap one hard-boiled egg with the flattened sausage mixture.

Repeat with the remaining eggs and sausage mixture.

Dip each sausage-wrapped egg into the beaten egg.

Roll each sausage-wrapped egg in bread crumbs.

Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a pot over medium heat.

Fry each sausage-wrapped egg for about 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.

Remove the sausage-wrapped eggs from the oil with a slotted spoon and place them on paper towels to drain excess oil.

Serve the Scotch eggs hot or cold.

Snacks.Title: Egg Muffins
Snacks.Ingredients:
6 eggs
1/4 cup milk
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon black pepper
1/2 cup chopped vegetables (such as spinach, tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers)
1/4 cup shredded cheese
Snacks.Instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.
Grease a muffin tin with cooking spray.
Pour the egg mixture into the muffin cups, filling each one about 2/3 full.
Add chopped vegetables to each muffin cup.
Sprinkle shredded cheese on top of the vegetables.
Bake the egg

Snacks.Title: Salmon Cakes
Snacks.Ingredients:
2 cups cooked salmon, flaked
1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup chopped red onion
1/4 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1 tablespoon lemon juice
2 teaspoons Old Bay seasoning
Salt and pepper to taste
2 eggs, beaten
Olive oil for frying
Snacks.Instructions:
In a large mixing bowl, combine cooked salmon, panko breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, chopped red onion, chopped celery, chopped fresh parsley, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, Old Bay seasoning, salt, and pepper.

Mix until well combined.

Add beaten eggs to the mixture and mix until everything is evenly coated.

Form the mixture into small patties.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Fry salmon cakes until golden brown on both sides.

Drain on paper towels before serving.

Snacks.Title: Salmon Salad Stuffed Avocado
Snacks.Ingredients:
2 ripe avocados, halved and pitted
1 cup cooked salmon, flaked
1/4 cup chopped red onion
1/4 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Snacks.Instructions:
In a medium mixing bowl, combine cooked salmon, chopped red onion, chopped celery, chopped fresh parsley, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

Mix until well combined.

Scoop out some of the avocado flesh from each half to create a hollow.

Fill each avocado half with the salmon salad.

Serve immediately.

Snacks.Title: Classic Ham and Cheese Sandwich
Snacks.Ingredients:
2 slices of bread
2-3 slices of ham
2 slices of cheddar cheese
1-2 tablespoons mayonnaise
1-2 teaspoons mustard
Lettuce and tomato (optional)
Snacks.Instructions:
Toast the bread slices if desired.

Spread mayonnaise and mustard on one or both slices of bread.

Place ham slices on one slice of bread.

Add cheese slices on top of the ham.

Top with lettuce and tomato if desired.

Close the sandwich with the other slice of bread.

Serve immediately.
